liquid.gui

Class ParameterPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • liquid.gui.ParameterPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class ParameterPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Sets up some of the parameters to be used during the simulation, all changeable by the user. This includes the type of liquid, temperature, viscosity, and run time; but most importantly, it creates the Run, Pause, Step, and End buttons.

    A replay check-box has also been added to indicate when a simulation is running a previously saved set of parameters.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ParameterPanel

        public ParameterPanel()
        Constructor for the parameter panels. Currently, it is located on the right side of the simulator, excluding the details of the 'Environment Editor:' section.

    • Method Detail

      • liqsParam

        public void liqsParam()
        Method adjusts the liquid drop-down, which then adjusts the temperature/viscosity drop-down accordingly.

      • setLiquidType

        public void setLiquidType()
        Method gathers information based on the liquid type selected. It then promptly resets the drop-down values of the temperature/viscosity to prevent the simulation from running using a solid or a gas.

      • tempAndViscParam

        public void tempAndViscParam(float tempMin,
                             float tempMax,
                             float viscMin,
                             float viscMax)
        Method adjusts the temperature/viscosity parameters to be within the limitations of a liquid type, determined by the config file. This prevents the simulation from running when a liquid has become a solid or a gas.
        Parameters:
        tempMin - - melting point of the liquid
        tempMax - - boiling point of the liquid
        viscMin - - viscosity at the melting point
        viscMax - - viscosity at the boiling point

      • runButton

        public void runButton()
        Method creates the Run button of the ParameterPanel class, which will begin a simulation when all of the conditions have been met, such as a correct log file.

      • pauseButton

        public void pauseButton()
        Method creates the Pause button, which will pause the simulation. During this time, however, the user is unable to change any parameter details.

      • stepButton

        public void stepButton()
        Method creates the Step button, which will proceed through the simulation one frame at a time. Once pressed, the simulation is technically running, so no parameter configurations are allowed.

      • endButton

        public void endButton()
        Method creates the End button, which ends the simulation. Once pressed, the log file will be complete for replay, and any changes made will prompt the user to specify the log file name again.

      • prepareSim

        public void prepareSim(liquid.gui.ParameterPanel.SetSim route,
                       java.lang.String filename)
        Used for the Step/Run button to extract setting various parameters when setting up a simulation. This includes button enabling/disabling and sending notices to the Logger/Engine to write the log file and run simulation.
        Parameters:
        route - - determines the route to take
        filename - - to pass in the file name (for new simulations only)

      • setParamToRun

        public void setParamToRun()
        Method sets the parameters to the selected values after the Run button has been pressed.

      • setUndoParam

        public void setUndoParam()
        Method sets the parameters after the user has pressed the Undo button.

      • logUpdate

        public void logUpdate()
        The parameters in the parameter panel will get their values updated based on the information from the log file.

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enable)
        Method will enable/disable the parameters defined in the parameter panel.
        Overrides:
        setEnabled in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        enable - - to enable/disable components

      • reset

        public void reset()
        The simulation will revert the parameters back to the original default settings.
